alfredsnippet.snippet:
Weinberg, "Facing Up: Science and Its Cultural Adversaries (Harvard Univ. Press, 2001), p.37

"So I find it difficult to imagine that the future synthesis of everything will not be in the language of quantum mechanics.  Quantum mechanics is a grammar, in terms of which all physics must be expressed, but it does not itself tell us anything. That is one of the reasons it is hard to test, because by itself it says nothing."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Quantum Mechanics is a Grammar
